thread.title: MACC detains senior military officer in Pahang for alleged graft
thread.title_full: MACC detains senior military officer in Pahang for alleged graft

title: MACC detains senior military officer in Pahang for alleged graft
text:
More 
A senior military officer who served at Wisma Angkatan Tentera in Temerloh, Pahang was detained by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) today for alleged corruption. According to sources, the 57-year-old suspect who held the rank of Lieutenant Colonel was arrested at the Temerloh MACC office at about 2.30pm today. Sources also said the suspect was present at the MACC office to give a statement related to the investigation into the case involving him."The suspect, who was in charge of overseeing contractors as well as verifying the standard specifications process by contactors was believed to have accepted bribes from proxy contractors, including a company owned by his father, where his wife is a director," said the sources. MACC deputy commissioner (Operations), Datuk Azam Baki when contacted by Bernama confirmed the arrest. 
"I confirm the detention of the suspect today and there will be more arrests in connection with the investigation of this case," he said but declined to comment further. - Bernama
